title: Impressive!!
comment: Excellent quality, easy to use. For a new release, it would be nice to be able to select the different residues.
Helpful app.

title: Effin Gorgeous
comment: Android needed a pdb viewer and this one is far better than I ever would have expected. Props to you Dev! There are some minor things (would love an option drawer instead of the option circle and some metal ions wouldn't show up) but very nice overall

title: Awesome
comment: Wonderful idea for introducing this app.I am speechless to say anything.Who so ever that "mind" is seriously true intellect:)

Does not open on my Samsung Tab S, worked with EsMol, for those who do not have a menu button I got this to work with the menu button on my Samsung keyboard, would be much more useful if amino acid sequences could be displayed like in Pymol

title: Android 5.0x incompatible?
comment: Used to love this all, but it stopped working after upgrade to Lollypop (Nexus4)

title: Not working with android 5.0
comment: Worked fine till I upgraded to lollypop. Now it opens and appears to download molecules but does not display them.
Sorry for inconvenience. I started investigating this problem.
Nice

title: Great work still.needs an improvement
comment: Great work. The only thing required is to allow the nucleic acid structures to render as well. Which makes it better

title: Exceeds expectations
comment: I recently purchased a Note 10.1 2014, and I was curious if there were any android apps that would let me fetch and view protein structures from the PDB. This app far exceeded my expectations. It has the smoothest rendering of any viewer I've used, including desktop applications. It allows various color options, display of the biological unit, fetching from the PDB. I'm sure there are some advanced options that were removed, but for a tablet viewer, I'm hugely impressed.

title: Very good!
comment: Extremely well built, just one thing though. Add drawing and SMILES capabilities plz.
Works better than others

title: fast and clear
comment: Well done. It would be nice if you add some sort of sequence instrument like s button in pymol.

title: probably the best molecular structure viewer on mobile device
comment: excellent !

title: bs app
comment: the image is worsethan anything I have seen  and you cannot manipulate the molecule as you should.

title: Nice
comment: Love it, helps so much in undergrad biochemistry class.
Excellent free app to view pdbs

title: No landscape; can't see individual residues.
comment: Renders really fast, looks gorgeous, and gives good display options with an unobtrusive interface. Can display the PDB header. However, I have an ASUS Transformer with a dock, so I need to keep my tablet oriented landscape. NDKmol's inability to handle landscape orientation lost it 2 stars (again, I NEED it landscape). Also, I would like to see what individual residues are, as well as ligands--perhaps with one tap.

title: Excellent
comment: This app is so great. It does pretty extensive molecular visualizations with the limited power of a handheld. Must-see! The only missing feature is app2SD

title: Superb
comment: This app is fantastic. Smooth and renders beautifully. Would love it if you could include stereo views as well.

title: Asus TF 700T fail?
comment: When I open the app I only see what I think is the initial splash screen molecule? No menu is visible or accessible from any point on the screen. The molecule looks wonderful and is fully interactive and easily controlled which makes me very sad that I can't use this app.

title: Excellent
comment: I love that NDKmol recognises ligands and draws them in a different representation to the protein. The feature I would like to see most now is trajectories (e.g. when frames in a PDB are separated by END cards).  More multi-touch support would also be nice: 2 finger drag to move (similar to how you change pitch in google earth), and 2finger rotate to allow rotations in the axis perpendicular to the screen.  I can see myself using this app in meetings with my supervisor.

title: The best molecular viewer
comment: This app is so fluid and responsive and loaded with lots of cool features that i could not resist myself from giving it 5 stars

title: Ankit K
comment: Awesome... Easy  to understand, easy to study . Really a good app.

title: I can't get it to view .mol
comment: I guess my problem stems from not knowing how to use it, or the program not being designed for what I need. I need to view .mol files - for Phthalocyanines, Porphyrins, POMs, etc. I want it that even if my computer is screwed up, I can function and look at a molecule... help?

title: Wonderful
comment: Was waiting for pymol to come to android, but this looks just as great, and the touch features make navigation very intuitive. The thick ribbons work just fine on my Galaxy S II and Transformer Infinity. Please make an optimized tablet version, I'd also love to be able to search and center on specific residues and active sites. I wonder how much trouble it would be to add a ray trace rendering function? ;)

title: zc
comment: great

title: Awsum !!
comment: Its too good.. Thanks.. Please add stereo feature too..

title: Useful app
comment: Great job, thank you.
Grrearz

title: Great!
comment: Works fine on my galaxy S. Really neat tool, thanks to the developer.

title: Meh
comment: More hassle to deal with settings than it's worth.

title: awesome app!
comment: I've been looking for something like this for a long time.  Good work!

title: Gr8 app
comment: Nice app for mobile. Hope to see it improved in nearby future, like some desktop application

title: Fantastic
comment: It would be nice to have the display molecule in full screen. Also does not display nucleic acids properly.

title: Can't seem to open PDB files
comment: Can't seem to open PDB files. Got them from internet and put them in the PDB folder. But the app keeps on showing me the sample file.

title: Color not working on Galaxy Nexus
comment: Runs great, but coloring does not seem to work, ribbon structures always displayed as white.

title: Fast application with a number of display options
comment: I am impressed this application can open such large protein molecules and display them in a smooth manner. I also like the number of options that are given to customize the appearance of the protein. The only other feature I would like is a way to quickly check the HEADER of the protein, and possibly some of the other human readable pieces of information stored in the pdb file.

title: Really smooth
comment: This is a great app for checking out structures on the go, whilst reading papers on the train for example. Really impressed with the quality of the rendering. Would be nice to see space fill, and surface options.
Best pdb viewer yet! Actually allows to visualize proteins as ribbons and highlights secondary structure and ligands. Loving it :)

title: Splendid start and lots of potential
comment: Thanks for a great first release. Looking forward to future updates.
very good start. ocationally freezes though.
